title: NIPS_2001_11_abs

sentences.text: A mixed-signal paradigm is presented for high-resolution parallel inner-product computation in very high dimensions , suitable for efficient implementation of kernels in image processing .
At the core of the externally digital architecture is a high-density , low-power analog array performing binary-binary partial matrix-vector multiplication .
Full digital resolution is maintained even with low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion , owing to random statistics in the analog summation of binary products .
A random modulation scheme produces near-Bernoulli statistics even for highly correlated inputs .
The approach is validated with real image data , and with experimental results from a CID/DRAM analog array prototype in 0.5 cents m CMOS .

Entity-the_approach.label: The approach
Entity-the_approach.description: A mixed-signal paradigm for high-resolution parallel inner-product computation validated using real image data and experimental results from a CID/DRAM analog array prototype.

Entity-the_externally_digital_architectu.label: the externally digital architecture
Entity-the_externally_digital_architectu.description: A mixed-signal system consisting of an analog array performing binary-binary partial matrix-vector multiplication, which maintains full digital resolution despite low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion.

Entity-high-resolution_parallel_inner-pr.label: high-resolution parallel inner-product computation
Entity-high-resolution_parallel_inner-pr.description: An analog array-based computational method that performs partial matrix-vector multiplication and maintains full digital resolution through random statistics in analog summation.

summary: A mixed-signal paradigm is presented for high-resolution parallel inner-product computation in very high dimensions , suitable for efficient implementation of kernels in image processing . At the core of the externally digital architecture is a high-density , low-power analog array performing binary-binary partial matrix-vector multiplication . Full digital resolution is maintained even with low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion , owing to random statistics in the analog summation of binary products . A random modulation scheme produces near-Bernoulli statistics even for highly correlated inputs . The approach is validated with real image data , and with experimental results from a CID/DRAM analog array prototype in 0.5 cents m CMOS .

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates a relationship where the subject provides or offers something to someone or something else. In this context, it suggests that the subject (A mixed-signal paradigm) makes available or demonstrates its capabilities for performing high-resolution parallel inner-product computation.

Predicate-is_suitable_for.label: is suitable for
Predicate-is_suitable_for.description: The predicate 'is suitable for' indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (the subject) has characteristics or properties that make it well-suited, effective, or efficient in performing or achieving something described by the other entity (the object).

Predicate-is_maintained_even_with.label: is maintained even with
Predicate-is_maintained_even_with.description: The predicate 'is maintained even with' indicates that despite the presence of a potential obstacle or limitation (object), the subject is able to maintain its integrity, quality, or functionality. This suggests a relationship where the object does not compromise or undermine the subject's ability to function as intended.

Predicate-produces.label: produces
Predicate-produces.description: The predicate 'produces' indicates a causal relationship between its subject and object, suggesting that the subject is responsible for or gives rise to the existence of the object. In this sense, it implies a transformation or generation process where the subject's properties or characteristics are transformed into the described state or characteristic represented by the object.

Predicate-is_validated_with.label: is validated with
Predicate-is_validated_with.description: Indicates that a subject (e.g., an approach, method, or process) has been tested and confirmed to be effective or accurate using the object (e.g., data, criteria, or standards). The predicate 'is validated with' establishes a connection between the subject's validity and the object used for validation.

Predicate-is_validated_by.label: is validated by
Predicate-is_validated_by.description: Indicates that a subject's validity or correctness is supported or confirmed by an object. The predicate 'is validated by' establishes a connection between the subject and the object, suggesting that the object serves as evidence, authority, or justification for the subject's validation.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or category within a larger domain or field denoted by the object. It represents an is-a relationship, where the subject is a more specialized or detailed concept compared to the object.
